org.trianacode.enactment

Class CommandLineExec

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.trianacode.enactment.TrianaExec
      • org.trianacode.enactment.CommandLineExec

  • public class CommandLineExec
extends TrianaExec
    A standalone class for executing a taskgraph using specified input data.

      • setParameter

        public void setParameter(java.lang.String paramname,
                java.lang.Object value)
        Sets the specified parameter, where paramname is a mapped paramname or of the form groupname.taskname.paramname

      • getParameter

        public java.lang.Object getParameter(java.lang.String paramname)
        Returns:
        the specified parameter value, where paramname is a mapped paramname or of the form groupname.taskname.paramname (returns null if parameter not set). Note that if the paramname is mapped to multiple parameters then the value of one is returned (but it is not defined which one!).

      • mapParameter

        public void mapParameter(java.lang.String map,
                java.lang.String paramname)
        Maps a parameter of the form groupname.taskname.paramname to a simple string (e.g. file). At the commandline the application user can write java TrianaExec -file afile.dat taskgraph.xml, as opposed to the full parameter name. Note that a string can be mapped to multiple parameter names. Also note that the preceeding - should not be included in the map string.

      • mapParameter

        public void mapParameter(java.lang.String map,
                java.lang.String paramname,
                java.lang.Object value)
        Maps a parameter of the form groupname.taskname.paramname to a simple string (e.g. verbose), along with the value that the parameter is set to (e.g. new Boolean(true)). At the commandline the application user can write java TrianaExec -verbose taskgraph.xml. Note that a string can be mapped to multiple parameter names+values.

      • unmap

        public void unmap(java.lang.String map)
        Unmaps all the mappings from a string.

      • isMapped

        public boolean isMapped(java.lang.String map)
        Returns:
        true if the specified string is a map

      • getMappedParameters

        public java.lang.String[] getMappedParameters(java.lang.String map)
        Returns:
        the parameter names mapped to the specified map

      • isMappedValue

        public boolean isMappedValue(java.lang.String map,
                    java.lang.String paramname)
        Returns:
        the value mapped to the specified map/paramname pair (or null if not specified)

      • getMappedValue

        public java.lang.Object getMappedValue(java.lang.String map,
                              java.lang.String paramname)
        Returns:
        the value mapped to the specified map/paramname pair (or null if not specified)

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(java.lang.String map,
                  java.lang.String description)
        Sets a description for the specified map string. This description can take the form " main description" if required.

      • removeDescription

        public void removeDescription(java.lang.String map)
        Removes the description for the specified map

      • getFullDescription

        public java.lang.String getFullDescription(java.lang.String map)
        Returns:
        the full description string for the specified map

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription(java.lang.String map)
        Returns:
        the description string for the specified map. If the description string was specified as " main description" then only the main description is returned.

      • getItemTag

        public java.lang.String getItemTag(java.lang.String map)
        Returns:
        the item tag for the specified map if the description was specified as " main description". Otherwise null is returned.

      • initParameters

        public java.lang.String initParameters(java.lang.String[] args)
        Initialises the parameters for the specified command line arguments.
        Returns:
        either a help message or error message, or null if no message is needed.
